Which file did you try to open?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Which file did you try to open?
> 
Hi,
    When I open the source file of a Class file I catch the exception of 'Unmatched braces in the pattern'.
    My eclipse plugins contains EMF2.1.1 RCP3.1.1 GEF3.1.1.

Could not reproduce.
Could you please provide the .class file that you tried to open + build ID + the Vm you are using?
Thanks.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Could not reproduce.
> Could you please provide the .class file that you tried to open + build ID +
> the Vm you are using?
> Thanks.
> 
Hi,
   I can reproduce the problem.
   When I open the third_part jars I catch this problem(such as apache's commons),but not the standard class such as String.My build Id is eclipse.buildId=M20060118-1600. My Vm is jre1.5.0_04.
The message is :Unable to create editor ID org.eclipse.jdt.ui.ClassFileEditor: Unmatched braces in the pattern.
That is I could provide.
Change version since this build seems to be 3.1.2.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Change version since this build seems to be 3.1.2.
> 
I found this problem exist at 3.1.2 as of old.
At the same time I found this because of NLpack1-eclipse-SDK-3.1.1a-win32.zip.
I could caught this problem when I had installed NLpack1,in spite of the version of eclipse(3.1.0 ,3.1.1, 3.1.2)

This looks like a bug in the nl pack.
I'll investigate.

This is a bug in the localized messages.
In the file:
org/eclipse/jdt/internal/core/util/messages_zh.properties
Change:

disassembler_opentypedeclaration=\ \u201C{\u201D

for:

disassembler_opentypedeclaration=\ '{'

And it should be fine.
